content: 1 single_crochet next 4 st 1hdc 3dc in same st 1 double_crochet in next 3 st slip_stitch into standing double_crochet or chain three *this helps even out the top and bottom stitch count round two make a chain 3 alternative as shown in my youtube video how to make a pumpkin granny square time stamp 7 30 or chain 3 chain 3 alternative is for looks it is not necessary *we are now working in both loops* 1dc next 3 st 2dc same stitch chain 2 2dc same stitch 1hdc next 8 st 2dc same st chain 2 2dc same st 1dc next 8st 2dc same st ch2 2 double_crochet same st 1hdc next 8 st 2dc same st chain 2 2dc same st 1 double_crochet next 4 st slip_stitch into chain 3 alternative or chain 3 cut your yarn and secure your end the stem embroidery switch to the color you chose for your stem and take out your needle to make my stem i like to embroider a rectangle above the top of my pumpkin about a half inch in length and a quarter inch in height i then create vertical lines up and down across the length of this rectangle filling in the space the stem should cover our increase at the top of the pumpkin feel free to find a method that works for you congratulations you have now completed your pumpkin granny square make sure to weave in all your ends for security steaming or wet blocking will help with any curling i hope you enjoyed the pattern and remember to check out my youtube channel more than yarn if you need any help along the way
